item.title: The Unit Test Paradox
item.description: The unit test paradox is the paradox that low level unit testing “drives” good design by itself being a form of bad design. Low level unit tests tightly couple to code All tests couple to something - end to end tests couple to the body of the architecture as a whole. Lower level integration tests couple to lower level implementation details. The lower the level of the testing, the tighter it couples to the implementation.
